page.title: 06FURTHER EDUCATION II
page.content: {LACKHAM COLLEGE Contd:- Three farms exist on the estate each specialising in a particular aspect of farming which includes Friesan and Ayrshire Dairy herds, arable and a pig unit. Housed on the site is a{farm {implement and artifact}museum, which was established in 1948 and this year has undergone a major expansion with the relocation of an{18th century timber framed brick infilled{thatched {barn}from the{Burdedrop Estate Wroughton. A large walled garden close to the house contains the efforts of the horticultural department. Various new strains of flowers and vegetables are developed here. Students are provided with leisure and sports facilities eg rugby,cricket
